availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas V. Dills (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and slaveholder. )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky, native. Married to Ann Mariah Houston Dills in Harrison County, Kentucky on December 20, 1842. Father of Susan C. Dills. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Merchant in Harrison County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Farmer in Harrison County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 160A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 406.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 584.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 123A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, Month 1864, p. 67.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216885.
